title.native: ヴィンランド・サガ SEASON2

description:
The second season of Vinland Saga.

After his father's death and the destruction of his village at the hands of English raiders, Einar wishes for a peaceful life with his family on their newly rebuilt farms. However, fate has other plans: his village is invaded once again. Einar watches helplessly as the marauding Danes burn his lands and slaughter his family. The invaders capture Einar and take him back to Denmark as a slave.

Einar clings to his mother's final words to survive. He is purchased by Ketil, a kind slave owner and landlord who promises that Einar can regain his freedom in return for working in the fields. Soon, Einar encounters his new partner in farm cultivation—Thorfinn, a dejected and melancholic slave. As Einar and Thorfinn work together toward their freedom, they are haunted by both sins of the past and the ploys of the present. Yet they carry on, grasping for a glimmer of hope, redemption, and peace in a world that is nothing but unjust and unforgiving.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Rotoscoping
tags.description: Animation technique that animators use to trace over motion picture footage, frame by frame, to produce realistic action.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

name.native: トルフィン・カルルセヴニ
ハルドル・エリス・オラフソン

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/makotoyukimura)

Before writing his own manga he started out as an assistant to Shin Morimura. He debuted in 2000 with Planetes, which was adapted to a 26-episode anime. He is currently working on Vinland Saga which began serialization in Weekly Shounen Magazine, and later on continued serialization in Afternoon.

He has won the 2009 Japan Media Arts Festival Grand Prize for Vinland Saga.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1848968246)

Formerly from Madbox, currently employed at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/). Additionally, he serves as a Board member at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/t_bamboo)

He grew up in Mexico because of his parents' work. In elementary school he read Ishinomori Shoutarou's Cyborg 009. Later he experienced the Yamato and Gundam boom, prompting him to be interested in animation. He started working as background artist, later becoming freelance. During that time Takeda got acquainted with Tokuhiro Hiragi and Tatsuya Kushida, whom he then helped establishing the art studio Bihou in 1993.

In 2005 he established the independent art studio Bamboo, which became a company in 2007.

(Source: AniDB)
Kimura Kashiko is an editor working for Mad Box.
Shouji Hata is an Audio Engineer.

[Website](https://www.yutakayamada.com/)

Yutaka Yamada is a Los Angeles-based music composer known for his work on the anime television series "Tokyo Ghoul", "VINLAND SAGA" and major Japanese films such as "Death Note:Light Up the New World", "BLEACH" and "KINDGOM". His masterpiece soundtracks for "Tokyo Ghoul" have gained worldwide popularity with related videos totaling over 70 million views on Youtube.

In 2018, Yamada composed for "Cry Me a Sad River", a Chinese film which had succeeded with USD $51Mil. In the same year, Eminem sampled Yamada's master piece "Glassy Sky (from "Tokyo Ghoul")" on his song "Good Guy" in his "Kamikaze" album. 
In 2019, he has worked alongside Sony Pictures for their mega-hit live-action film "KINGDOM" in which he received nomination for the 43rd Japan Academy Film Prize for Best Music Score. WIT Studio, famous for producing "Attack on Titan", released their most anticipated animation series "VINLAND SAGA", with an original soundtrack composed entirely by Yamada. 

Born in 1989, Yamada graduated from Senzoku Gakuen College of Music where he passionately studied musical composition. In 2009, he entered and won the first prize at VIENNA INSTRUMENTS Strings Arrangement Contest.

Today, he is represented by Soundtrack Music Associates, and has since relocated his production base from Tokyo to Sonic Fuel Studios in Los Angeles.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/lmykstaff) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/lmykmusic/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCywnAZhXindfqW0vHhvvciQ/) |  [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@lmykmusicofficial)  | [Old Website](https://www.lmyk.jp/) | [New Website](https://www.lisamonika-yk.com/) | [Old Spotify (LMYK)](https://open.spotify.com/intl-de/artist/7a2CrMd3xwcZDDC39OKUGg) | [New Spotify (Lisa Monika YK)](https://open.spotify.com/intl-de/artist/0Kk6nIkrAuKm2vQN3qVguF)

Japanese-German singer-songwriter.

Formerly known as only LMYK, Lisa Monika YK decided to share her name on [November 1st, 2024](https://www.lisamonika-yk.com/news/hellonovember) to mark a new chapter as an artist. The initials will still be LMYK, but she wants to connect more authentically by sharing her name.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1848968246)

Formerly from Madbox, currently employed at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/). Additionally, he serves as a Board member at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).
